[Urgent Letter]

. Please return to Kaiator as soon as possible. The Goddess is angry, and calls for your counsel.

- Tamur

You brought word about Argon activity in the Exodor Archipelago to Kaia.

Furious at the corruption and further defilement of Kelsaik's remains, Kaia decided to equip you with better gear, forged with an ancient process unknown to mortal smiths.

, you're here! and not a moment too soon.

The Commander is waiting for you inside.

It's a pleasure to see you again !

I just wish it was under better circumstances. Elleon's passing will have repercussions far beyond the loss of a true friend.

Is it true that the Argons are active in the Exodor Archipelago? The strategic implications of this do not bode well, and Kaia is furious.

, you must speak to her as soon as possible.

, you and I have seen firsthand that the Argons can never be defeated, but I at least hoped we had them contained.

But this latest atrocity must not...they dare...they DARE to mutilate the body of a god! This is an outrage I cannot forgiveâ€”or forget.

You must bring me some of their new weapons. Bring them to me, and I will help you forge weapons and armor more powerful than any mortal smith can imagine.

Return to Exodor, , and be my sword again.

Job well done .

This won't take long. Please wait while I examine these."Yes, Shieldmaiden."

I can sense the strength of Balder within these items. Specifically the energy of his eyes, which light our world.

Azarts, Argons, I no longer care. All who steal from the gods and corrupt their power must be held accountable.

We must forge a powerful weapon for you as soon as possible."When do we start?"

For the designs I have in mind we'll need a special kind of anvil, one equal to that used to forge the Spear of Gidd.

The only living smith who can...use one is Fovarth, in Habere.

Go to Fovarth, , and I will join you directly.
You must find a clue to their power source.

Kaia wants me to prepare an anvil to forge a new kind of gear?

I knew a day like this would come. The Shieldmaiden's wish is my command.

Just give me the specifications and I'll begin."Only she knows them."
Then we shall await her arrival.

Fovarth. You are among the finest mortal smiths I have ever seen.

When Balder locked the power of the gods away, I lost the ability to create great weapons. But you, you have transcended your nature, and have the skills we need to succeed against the Argons.

To make what needs, you and I must prepare an anvil with two specific materials.

I have the first with me, but must supply the other."What is it?"

Sikander was once surrounded with a blazing aura called the Sikandari Fire.

Although Sikander is gone, even the slightest ember of that fire will be enough to complete the anvil."Where can I find it?"

Within Kelsaik.

Even though the Azart have resurrected him with Argon power, some portion of his former life as the god Sikander must remain.

Engage him in battle, and bring back a Primal Ember formed from his essense.

I never thought I'd see this again, let alone hold it in my hands.

To stop the Argons, this small ember must be fanned into a living flame.

Prepare yourself, Fovarth.
We need that ember. Without the ember we can't forge you a weapon equal to your task.

I...such power... It's impossible to describe this feeling.

, the anvil stands ready. Come back to me when you are ready to upgrade your gear.
